title: Core Function
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed on the Android device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I open the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I must see five tabs in the tab bar

AND tapping on these tabs must allow me to navigate to additional content

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN  the app is open and in the background

AND I foreground the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should resume my session on the same tab as where I left off (Refresh behavior for this content will be determined on a view-by-view basis)

title: Localization
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed on an Android device
custom_steps: WHEN I set my device set to any Spanish language setting
custom_expected:
THEN I will see Spanish labels in the tab bar
NOTE: MLB Network is displayed the same in English and Spanish.

title: Active/Inactive non team Icons
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed on an Android device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN my app or OS settings are set to Dark Mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I will see a dark mode version of the tab bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN my device is set to dark mode
AND I select any of the non-team icons
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the selected icon should fill in with the team's secondary color
AND the unselected icons should be the uncolored grayscale icons
AND all icons should be clearly visible

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN my device is set to light mode
AND I select any of the non-team icons
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the selected icon should fill in with the team's secondary color
AND the unselected icons should be the uncolored grayscale icons
AND all icons should be clearly visible

title: MLB Configurable Tabs & Order
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed on the Android device

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I foreground the app 

AND the tab bar order config has been adjusted
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I will see the new tab bar order

AND I will remain on the view I was previously viewing if the view has not been disabled

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I foreground the app 

AND the tab bar order config has been adjusted
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN I will see the new tab bar order

AND I will be shown the default tab if the view I was previously viewing has been disabled

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user has lost network connectivity

AND a user foregrounds the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a user should see the last successfully fetched tab bar config

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user has lost network connectivity

AND a user has never fetched a new tab bar config

AND a user foregrounds the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a user should see the default bundled tab bar order for that version

title: User Setting: Default Tab
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with the app installed on an Android device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN I navigate to the Settings area
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I must be presented with an option to set my default tab from one of the pre-defined options

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user who has navigated to the Default Tab Setting
AND I select my default tab setting
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app must remember this setting for my device

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN  a user who has not selected a default tab setting

AND I start the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be shown the first tab of the app, known as the “MLB Default”

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user who has selected a default tab setting

AND the default tab setting I’ve selected is in another position in the tab bar

AND Starting the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be shown my default tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user who has selected a default tab setting

AND the default tab setting I’ve selected is NOT currently found in the tab bar

AND starting the app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN I should be shown the “MLB Default” tab

title: Accessibility Talk Back
custom_expected: THEN talkback reads aloud “menu item [label]” (ENG and SP)

title: Accessibility Text Size
custom_preconds: GIVEN a device with large text size
custom_steps: WHEN a menu item is selected
custom_expected: THEN the label text is rendered larger than usual

title: Team Page tab bar icon- active and inactive

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I select the teams page tab for any team
AND the app theme is set to light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team icon in the tab bar should be the full color version of the icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I select a tab other than the teams page
AND the app theme is set to light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team icon in the tab bar should be inactive greyscale version of the icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I select the teams page tab for any team
AND the app theme is set to dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team icon in the tab bar should be the full color version of the icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN I select a tab other than the teams page
AND the app theme is set to dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team icon in the tab bar should be inactive greyscale version of the icon

title: Postseason Schedule Tab
custom_preconds: GIVEN it is postseason or the attached file is locally mapped to eg. https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com:443/atbatconfig/appnavigation_en.json	/Users/greg.caron/Mast/appnavigation_en.json using Charles

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the tab bar is viewed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Postseason tab is present with the postseason icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the Postseason tab is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Postseason webview displays

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a different tab is tapped (eg. Team)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN that tab opens

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN it is not Postseason and the attached file is not mapped in Charles
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Postseason tab does not display

title: Watch View Tab
custom_steps: Note: the attached files can be mapped to eg. https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com/atbatconfig/appnavigation_en.json to mock Mast tool configs

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the MAST config tool enables Watch in the first 5
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Watch tab displays in the tab bar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the MAST config tool disables Watch in the first 5
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Watch tab does not display in the tab bar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the tab bar is viewed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Watch tab will display
AND it will have the 'tv' icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the Watch tab is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Watch view opens

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the app is in light mode
AND the Watch tab is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Watch view will have the light theme (Note: the Film room tab is always in dark mode.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the app is in dark mode 
AND the Watch tab is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Watch view will have the dark theme

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the MAST config tool enables Watch to display after the first 5 (eg. 6th)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Watch will display in the drawer
AND it will have the 'tv' icon
